trans-unit.source: Construction Setup

seg-source.mrk: Construction Setup

trans-unit.source: This topic describes setup pages located within the Setup and GAEB menu groups in the Construction, Administration menu.

seg-source.mrk: This topic describes setup pages located within the Setup and GAEB menu groups in the Construction, Administration menu.

trans-unit.source: EFB Surcharges

seg-source.mrk: EFB Surcharges

trans-unit.source: The EFB Surcharges page is used to define the surcharges that need to be included in a calculation document (refer to topic “EFB Calculation” on page 1).

seg-source.mrk: The EFB Surcharges page is used to define the surcharges that need to be included in a calculation document (refer to topic “EFB Calculation” on page 1).

trans-unit.source: : EFB Surcharge

seg-source.mrk: : EFB Surcharge

trans-unit.source: The fields on this page are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on this page are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Field

seg-source.mrk: Field

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: BoQ Job No.

seg-source.mrk: BoQ Job No.

trans-unit.source: Indicates a BoQ Job No. if the EFB Surcharge is specific to a job.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates a BoQ Job No.
if the EFB Surcharge is specific to a job.

trans-unit.source: Cost Type

seg-source.mrk: Cost Type

trans-unit.source: Identifies the Cost Type to which the EFB Surcharges are to be applied.

seg-source.mrk: Identifies the Cost Type to which the EFB Surcharges are to be applied.

trans-unit.source: Starting Date

seg-source.mrk: Starting Date

trans-unit.source: Indicates the starting date from which the EFB Surcharges are valid.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the starting date from which the EFB Surcharges are valid.

trans-unit.source: Preliminaries %

seg-source.mrk: Preliminaries %

trans-unit.source: Indicates the initial surcharges for on-site overhead relating to the Cost Type.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the initial surcharges for on-site overhead relating to the Cost Type.

trans-unit.source: Business Expenses %

seg-source.mrk: Business Expenses %

trans-unit.source: Indicates the surcharge for business expenses relating to the Cost Type.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the surcharge for business expenses relating to the Cost Type.

trans-unit.source: Risk %

seg-source.mrk: Risk %

trans-unit.source: Indicates the surcharge for project risk relating to the Cost Type.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the surcharge for project risk relating to the Cost Type.

trans-unit.source: Profit %

seg-source.mrk: Profit %

trans-unit.source: Indicates the surcharge for profits relating to the Cost Type.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the surcharge for profits relating to the Cost Type.

trans-unit.source: Total Surcharge %

seg-source.mrk: Total Surcharge %

trans-unit.source: Calculated total of all surcharges relating to the Cost Type.

seg-source.mrk: Calculated total of all surcharges relating to the Cost Type.

trans-unit.source: Subsections

seg-source.mrk: Subsections

trans-unit.source: Subsections are used to create a sub-structure of jobs used in projects.

seg-source.mrk: Subsections are used to create a sub-structure of jobs used in projects.

trans-unit.source: : Subsections

seg-source.mrk: : Subsections

trans-unit.source: A Subsection can be assigned in the General FastTab of the Job Card.

seg-source.mrk: A Subsection can be assigned in the General FastTab of the Job Card.

trans-unit.source: Contact Certificate Types

seg-source.mrk: Contact Certificate Types

trans-unit.source: Contact Certificate Types are used to identify contacts with special certificates, e.g., contacts that are exempt from taxes have an exemption certificate.

seg-source.mrk: Contact Certificate Types are used to identify contacts with special certificates, e.g., contacts that are exempt from taxes have an exemption certificate.

trans-unit.source: : Contact Certificate Types

seg-source.mrk: : Contact Certificate Types

trans-unit.source: Job Charge Types

seg-source.mrk: Job Charge Types

trans-unit.source: Job Charge Types are used in the Invoicing Template to find the correct G/L Account when the Charge Type is inserted in a new sales invoice line.

seg-source.mrk: Job Charge Types are used in the Invoicing Template to find the correct G/L Account when the Charge Type is inserted in a new sales invoice line.

trans-unit.source: : Job Charge Types

seg-source.mrk: : Job Charge Types

trans-unit.source: CS Invoicing Templates

seg-source.mrk: CS Invoicing Templates

trans-unit.source: The CS Invoicing Templates page displays a list of all CS Invoicing Templates, which are similar to calculation schedule templates in structure but are used to create Invoicing Schedules for Sales Invoices. To create a new template or open an existing template, click New or Edit on the ribbon.

seg-source.mrk: The CS Invoicing Templates page displays a list of all CS Invoicing Templates, which are similar to calculation schedule templates in structure but are used to create Invoicing Schedules for Sales Invoices.
To create a new template or open an existing template, click New or Edit on the ribbon.

trans-unit.source: : CS Invoicing Template

seg-source.mrk: : CS Invoicing Template

trans-unit.source: In the General FastTab, the Invoice Type field determines the type of invoice for which the calculation template will apply. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: In the General FastTab, the Invoice Type field determines the type of invoice for which the calculation template will apply.
The options are:

trans-unit.source: Invoice – used for Sales Invoices and Sales Orders

seg-source.mrk: Invoice – used for Sales Invoices and Sales Orders

trans-unit.source: Advance Payment – used for Advance Payment Invoices (which are part of the German-specific product cc|advance payment. Refer to your COSMO CONSULT consultant for more information about cc|advance payment.)

seg-source.mrk: Advance Payment – used for Advance Payment Invoices (which are part of the German-specific product cc|advance payment.
Refer to your COSMO CONSULT consultant for more information about cc|advance payment.)

trans-unit.source: Final Invoice – used for Final Invoices

seg-source.mrk: Final Invoice – used for Final Invoices

trans-unit.source: Part Invoice – used for Partial Sales Invoices

seg-source.mrk: Part Invoice – used for Partial Sales Invoices

trans-unit.source: The fields in the Lines FastTab are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields in the Lines FastTab are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Field

seg-source.mrk: Field

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Row No.

seg-source.mrk: Row No.

trans-unit.source: Unique code field that is used to identify a corresponding calculation line in the Totaling and Reference to Row No. fields.

seg-source.mrk: Unique code field that is used to identify a corresponding calculation line in the Totaling and Reference to Row No.
fields.

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Short description of the calculation.

seg-source.mrk: Short description of the calculation.

trans-unit.source: Totaling Type

seg-source.mrk: Totaling Type

trans-unit.source: Specifies what the calculation line is based on. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Specifies what the calculation line is based on.
The options are:

trans-unit.source: Sales Line – used to get the Total Sales Line Amount of all related Sales Lines.

seg-source.mrk: Sales Line – used to get the Total Sales Line Amount of all related Sales Lines.

trans-unit.source: Measurement – used to get the Total Sales Line Amount based on all related Measurement Lines.

seg-source.mrk: Measurement – used to get the Total Sales Line Amount based on all related Measurement Lines.

trans-unit.source:
Formula – used on lines that total other calculation lines with a mathematical formula. For example:
  • To use the value of the line with Row No. 10 multiplied by 2, enter R10 * 2.
  • To calculate the cost in Row No. 10, with a Charge % of 10, plus the costs in row 20, enter R10 * 10/100 + R20.

seg-source.mrk: Formula – used on lines that total other calculation lines with a mathematical formula.
For example:
<li>To use the value of the line with Row No.
10 multiplied by 2, enter R10 * 2.
<li>To calculate the cost in Row No.
10, with a Charge % of 10, plus the costs in row 20, enter R10 * 10/100 + R20.

trans-unit.source: Charge % – used to define the charge in percent to calculate within the line

seg-source.mrk: Charge % – used to define the charge in percent to calculate within the line

trans-unit.source: Sum – used on lines that total other calculation lines. Standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV filters can be used, such as range (1000..2000), either/or (1000|2000), or any of the following: * ? > < = @.

seg-source.mrk: Sum – used on lines that total other calculation lines.
Standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV filters can be used, such as range (1000..2000), either/or (1000|2000), or any of the following: * ? > < = @.

trans-unit.source: Totaling

seg-source.mrk: Totaling

trans-unit.source: Values relating to the selection in the Totaling Type field.

seg-source.mrk: Values relating to the selection in the Totaling Type field.

trans-unit.source: Charge Type

seg-source.mrk: Charge Type

trans-unit.source: Indicates a Job Charge Type to find the correct G/L Account when the charge is transferred to the sales line. Used only on lines with a Totaling Type of Charge %.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates a Job Charge Type to find the correct G/L Account when the charge is transferred to the sales line.
Used only on lines with a Totaling Type of Charge %.

trans-unit.source: Reference to Row No.

seg-source.mrk: Reference to Row No.

trans-unit.source: Refers to the row number that applies to the charge calculation. Used only on lines with a Totaling Type of Charge %.

seg-source.mrk: Refers to the row number that applies to the charge calculation.
Used only on lines with a Totaling Type of Charge %.

trans-unit.source: Value Transfer Option

seg-source.mrk: Value Transfer Option

trans-unit.source: Determines if and to where on a Sales Order or Sales Invoice the calculation value can be transferred when the “Transfer Value” function is run:

seg-source.mrk: Determines if and to where on a Sales Order or Sales Invoice the calculation value can be transferred when the “Transfer Value” function is run:

trans-unit.source: If selected, the template line is printed in the Sales Invoice Report.

trans-unit.source: GAEB Unit of Measure Allocation

seg-source.mrk: GAEB Unit of Measure Allocation

trans-unit.source: The GAEB Unit of Measure Assignment page is used to map units of measure from a GAEB file to units of measure in Microsoft Dynamics NAV during import.

seg-source.mrk: The GAEB Unit of Measure Assignment page is used to map units of measure from a GAEB file to units of measure in Microsoft Dynamics NAV during import.

trans-unit.source: : GAEB Unit of Measure Assignment page with various UOMs from GAEB files

seg-source.mrk: : GAEB Unit of Measure Assignment page with various UOMs from GAEB files

trans-unit.source: The fields in the GAEB Unit of Measure Assignment page are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields in the GAEB Unit of Measure Assignment page are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Field

seg-source.mrk: Field

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: GAEB Unit of Measure

seg-source.mrk: GAEB Unit of Measure

trans-unit.source: Indicates the unit of measure in the imported GAEB file. This field is case-sensitive.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the unit of measure in the imported GAEB file.
This field is case-sensitive.

trans-unit.source: Unit of Measure Code

seg-source.mrk: Unit of Measure Code

trans-unit.source: Indicates the corresponding unit of measure in Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the corresponding unit of measure in Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

trans-unit.source: Type

seg-source.mrk: Type

trans-unit.source: Indicates if the unit of measure is from an Item or a General Component (Misc.).

seg-source.mrk: Indicates if the unit of measure is from an Item or a General Component (Misc.).

trans-unit.source: Automatically populated from the Default UoM Allocation Type field in the BoQ Manager FastTab of the Jobs Setup page if set up during GAEB file import.

seg-source.mrk: Automatically populated from the Default UoM Allocation Type field in the BoQ Manager FastTab of the Jobs Setup page if set up during GAEB file import.

trans-unit.source: No.

seg-source.mrk: No.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the Item No. or General Component, based on the selection in the Type field.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the Item No.
or General Component, based on the selection in the Type field.

trans-unit.source: Automatically populated from the Default UoM Allocation No. field in the BoQ Manager FastTab of the Jobs Setup page if set up during GAEB file import.

seg-source.mrk: Automatically populated from the Default UoM Allocation No.
field in the BoQ Manager FastTab of the Jobs Setup page if set up during GAEB file import.

trans-unit.source: Sales Code

seg-source.mrk: Sales Code

trans-unit.source: Indicates the Job Sales Code that relates to the unit of measure.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the Job Sales Code that relates to the unit of measure.

trans-unit.source: Automatically populated from the Default UoM Allocation Sales Code field in the BoQ Manager FastTab of the Jobs Setup page if set up during GAEB file import.

seg-source.mrk: Automatically populated from the Default UoM Allocation Sales Code field in the BoQ Manager FastTab of the Jobs Setup page if set up during GAEB file import.

trans-unit.source: If the units in the GAEB file do not exist in Microsoft Dynamics NAV when a GAEB file is imported into a Job, it is possible to enter them into this page during import (refer to section <MadCap:xref href="Import GAEB File.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Import GAEB File” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: If the units in the GAEB file do not exist in Microsoft Dynamics NAV when a GAEB file is imported into a Job, it is possible to enter them into this page during import (refer to section <MadCap:xref href="Import GAEB File.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Import GAEB File” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).
